| --- |

| CPu (Caudate-putamen) |
| Cg (Cingulate cortex) |

Note: MDA (Malondialdehyde) and iNOS (Inducible nitric oxide synthase) are not diseases, but biomarkers of oxidative stress and inflammation, respectively. Therefore, they should not be included in the table as diseases.

Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: CB1 KO mice exhibited higher MDA levels and iNOS protein expression in the CPu and Cg compared to WT mice .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| MDA (Malondialdehyde) |

In the given paragraph, "higher MDA levels" refers to an increase in the amount of Malondialdehyde (MDA) in CB1 KO mice compared to WT mice.
